wikipedia_page.main:
Zoë Nathenson (born 1969) is a British actress.
In 1986, at the age of 17, she performed as daughter of Bob Hoskins in the film Mona Lisa. Nathenson operates her own film acting school.

response: Those Glory Glory Days is a 1983 British made-for-television film about football directed by Philip Saville and starring Zoë Nathenson, Sara Sugarman and Cathy Murphy. The screenplay was written by the sports journalist Julie Welch. The film is inspired by Welch's childhood love of football, and helped to establish her as a screenwriter. The film was part of David Puttnam's 'First Love' series broadcast on Channel 4. It was released on 17 November 1983.
